titleStmt.title: Loves better then gold: or Money's an ass. Come hear my song, it does you all concern, from it you may your own misfortunes learn: and yet 'tis vain, as hereby I shall prove, for want of money to neglect your love. To a new delightful tune, much in request at court.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, at the Hospital-gate, in West-smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Why should friends and kindred gravely make thee ..."
Date and place of publication from Wing.
Reproduction of originals in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
